intro: Cochlearia karsiana, commonly known as the Karsian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the family. Cochlearia karsiana is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves, which are often lobed or toothed.
